proposition: Nuclear power causes fewer deaths per unit of energy than coal

turns.user_message: How do the death rates from nuclear power compare to those from coal when looking at the number of fatalities per unit of energy produced?
turns.unknown_model_response:
The best‑available epidemiological and epidemiological‑risk studies show that, when measured in deaths per unit of electricity generated (typically expressed as deaths per terawatt‑hour, TWh), nuclear power has a much lower fatality rate than coal‑fired power.
